safety_edibility_notes: Protected under the Antarctic Treaty. Not hunted or consumed by humans. No commercial or subsistence use.
safety_warning_text: Emperor penguins pose no direct threat to humans. Main dangers are from Antarctic environment: extreme cold, isolation, and hazardous ice conditions.
safety_summary: Emperor penguins are not aggressive toward humans and are curious rather than fearful. The main risks in their habitat are environmental (extreme cold, crevasses, thin ice).
safety_contraindications: Maintain 5m minimum distance per Antarctic Treaty guidelines
encounter_protocol: Sit or crouch to appear less threatening. Allow penguins to approach if curious. Move slowly. Never block penguin access to water or colony.
